cmp: 氐 (name of an ancient tribe, foundation/on the whole)
mng: to press against, to support, to prop up, to resist, to equal, to balance, to make up for, to mortgage, to arrive at, to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)

exm.mng: generally speaking, by and large, for the most part
to counteract, to cancel out, to offset
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to resist, to boycott, to refuse (to cooperate), to reject, resistance, refusal
to resist, to hold back, to stop, to ward off, to withstand
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan, to put up collateral
